alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Fayette; Greene; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 2:56PM EST until November 18 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Monroe County in east central Ohio... Southern Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... South central Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Greene County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Fayette County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Northern Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Northeastern Wetzel County in northern West Virginia... Northern Preston County in northeastern West Virginia... Marshall County in northern West Virginia... * Until 400 PM EST. * At 256 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Youngwood to 9 miles northeast of New Martinsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 4 and 31. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 25 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 66 and 99. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 31. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 152 and 160. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Greensburg, Uniontown, Jeannette, Latrobe, Connellsville, Waynesburg, Westover, Star City, Monessen, California, and Donora. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Allegheny; Fayette; Greene; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland
